data.title: Solved: Scratches on Screen
data.meta_description: Solved: I have worn my new Fitbit Alta hr for two weeks and it already has scratches on the front. From normal activity. I reached out to Fitbit
data.text:
I have worn my new Fitbit Alta hr for two weeks and it already has scratches on the front. From normal activity. I reached out to Fitbit support and their solution was to provide me with a 25% off a new Fitbit product. In my opinion, a warning or screen protector should be provided if the screen can scratch as easily as mine has at this point. I take mine off if I am doing anything I think will damage it and I still have a few scratches. Not sure if other people have faced this problem and how they removed/attempted to remove the scratches? Any help would be appreciated.

Welcome to the forums!

Is it rubbing against something? as it sound like it is.

I always buy screen protectors for my Devices

This is what I bought for my Alta HR

https://www.amazon.com/Ace-Protector-Compatible-lifetime-Replacement/dp/B01BN57T18/ref=sr_1_3?ie=UTF...

Check out the discussions boards! A lot going on and I'm sure you have some contributions as well!

Hope to see you around!

Wendy | CA | Moto G6 Android

Want to discuss ways to increase your activity? Visit the Lifestyle Forum

Hey everyone,

I was just wondering if anyone else was having screen scratches or any kind of damage, I've had my Alta Hr, for a week short of 2 months, and i must say i have been very surprised at the screen quality, due to the number of scratches mine has accumulated. This is a product that is always on my wrist , so after 60 days of usage i have come to the board to see how you are experiencing your Alta hr.

@KDD0705 wrote:

I have worn my new Fitbit Alta hr for two weeks and it already has scratches on the front. From normal activity. I reached out to Fitbit support and their solution was to provide me with a 25% off a new Fitbit product. In my opinion, a warning or screen protector should be provided if the screen can scratch as easily as mine has at this point. I take mine off if I am doing anything I think will damage it and I still have a few scratches. Not sure if other people have faced this problem and how they removed/attempted to remove the scratches? Any help would be appreciated.

Any idea why they provided you with a 25 % off , i Tried to get through them and they were very informative with the information i asked about what is the screen made of , if it is the same as the alta.

I even inquired about a future rebate, but i was ignored on that regard, at this point knowing you got a 25 % rebate, kinda makes me wonder how they decide these things.

You can try this: I tried it with the scuffs and scratches on my Charge HR. Go to Autozone or any auto parts store and look for plastic polish in the wash and wax aisle. It's a polish to remove yellowing and scratches on dull plastic headlights. Should be around $6-$8. Get a clean microfiber towel and apply the polish to the plastic screen. Work on it pretty good then let it haze. Then get a clean part of that same microfiber towel and buff the screen. TADA! Should come out looking like new. If it doesn't, repeat the process.
